isis.stitle: 5 SPEED AND 6 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - PRECAUTIONS - REASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: REASSEMBLY
svcproc.para: Make sure that interiors of case and housings are clean. It is important that dirt and other foreign materials be kept out of the transmission during reassembly. Dirt is an abrasive and can damage polished surfaces of bearings and washers. Use certain precautions, as listed below, during reassembly.

step1.para: GASKETS-Use new gaskets throughout the transmission as it is being rebuilt. Make sure all gaskets are installed. An omission of any gasket can result in oil leakage or misalignment of bearing covers.
BOLTS-To prevent oil leakage, use Loctite 262 thread sealant on all bolts. For torque ratings, refer to the TORQUE CHART.
SHIMS-Apply a light coat of Loctite 510 to both sides of shims before final installation to prevent leakage.
O-RINGS-Lubricate all O-rings with silicon lubricant.
INITIAL LUBRICATION-Coat all thrust washers, synchronizers, and bearings with transmission lubricant during reassembly to prevent damage during initial start up.
AXIAL CLEARANCES-Maintain recommended axial clearances for mainshaft gears.
BEARINGS-Use of a sleeve type driver that contacts the inner race of the bearing is recommended to prevent damage to the rollers and cage while maintaining correct bearing alignment with the shaft.

svcproc.para: UNIVERSAL JOINT COMPANION FLANGE OR YOKE-Pull the companion flange or yoke tightly into place with the output shaft nut, using 300 to 350 ft-lbs. (407 to 475 N• m) of torque. Make sure the speedometer drive gear or a replacement spacer has been installed. Failure to properly tighten the nut can result in damage to the mainshaft rear bearing.
